text.text: How do I close an accounting period for the first time in ZOLL Billing?

text: To close an accounting period for the first time in ZOLL Billing, you must first click Accounting Periods on the navigation bar. Then, you must click Set my starting period. Finally, you must click the radio bullet next to a starting period date and scroll down to the bottom of the list and click Make this my starting period.

text.text: What are the steps involved in closing the first accounting period in ZOLL Billing?

text: To close the first accounting period in ZOLL Billing, you must: 1. Click Accounting Periods on the navigation bar. 2. Click Set my starting period. 3. Click the radio bullet next to a starting period date. 4. Scroll down to the bottom of the list and click Make this my starting period. 5. If you answered the question(s) in the affirmative, click Close now to close your first accounting period.

text.text: Can you explain the importance of closing the first accounting period?

text: Closing a period for the first time is an important step since it makes the starting period you selected permanent. The system prompts you with questions to ensure that you are ready to take that step and allows you an opportunity to change the starting period. You can only change the starting period until you close your first period. After you set the starting period, the system ignores the data of all the previous periods.

text.text: Where can I find the option to close the starting accounting period?

text: The charges, payments, and adjustments are in flux until you close the period; once closed, you cannot make modifications to that period. To get started, click Accounting Periods on the navigation bar.

text.text: What questions does the system prompt me with before closing the first period?

text: The system prompts you with questions to ensure that you are ready to take that step and allows you an opportunity to change the starting period. Once you close your first period, you cannot go back and change your starting period.

text.text: How can I verify that I've selected the correct starting period before closing?

text: You can verify that you've selected the correct starting period by clicking the radio bullet next to a starting period date. Scroll down to the bottom of the list and click Make this my starting period. When the page reloads, you will see several changes.

text.text: What happens if there are periods prior to the one I selected for closing?

text: If there are periods prior to the one you selected, the system will warn you that those periods will be ignored. You can only close accounting periods in sequential order - always the oldest period first. The system will ignore all charges and credits users added prior to the starting period. Users will receive an error message if they try to enter a claim with a date of service that falls within the range of an ignored accounting period.

text.text: Is there an option to ignore periods prior to the selected starting period?

text: Yes, you can click Yes ignore those periods. All periods prior to the period you selected are grayed out and marked "Ignored" which means that their balances and balance forward values (marked n/a) do not count.

text.text: What should I do if I want to proceed with closing the first accounting period?

text: Once you close your first period, you cannot go back and change your starting period. You can change the starting period at any time until you close your first period. You can reconcile issues and then post the period, or you can click Close anyway to close the accounting period without reconciling the issues.

text.text: What are the implications of closing the first accounting period for future entries and adjustments?

text: Once you close the first accounting period, you can only close accounting periods in sequential order - always the oldest period first. The system will ignore all charges and credits users added prior to the starting period.

text.text: How to Closing a period for the first time ?

text: To close a period for the first time, you must select the period you want to set as your starting period. You can change the starting period at any time until you close your first period. Once you set the starting period, the system ignores the data of all the previous periods.
